data.chText: 愚蠢；愚笨；愚蠢的想法（或事情、行为）
data.enText: a lack of good judgement; the fact of doing sth stupid; an activity or idea that shows a lack of judgement

data.chText: 放弃一份安定的工作似乎愚蠢至极。
data.enText: Giving up a secure job seems to be the height of folly.

data.chText: 拒绝这个建议是愚蠢之举。
data.enText: It would be folly to turn the offer down.

data.chText: （常见于旧时乡间豪宅花园中的）装饰性建筑
data.enText: a building that has no practical purpose but was built in the past for decoration, often in the garden of a large country house

means: 愚蠢的想法(或事情、行为)
(常见于旧时乡间豪宅花园中的)装饰性建筑

tr: the trait of acting stupidly or rashly
the quality of being rash and foolish
example: trying to drive through a blizzard is the height of folly
adjusting to an insane society is total foolishness

value.def: If you say that a particular action or way of behaving is folly or a folly, you mean that it is foolish.

example.ex: It's sheer folly to build nuclear power stations in a country that has dozens of earthquakes every year.
example.tran: 在每年会发生几十次地震的国家建造核电站简直就是愚蠢至极。

example.ex: ...a reminder of the follies of war.
example.tran: 提醒人们战争之愚蠢的东西

gramarinfo.label: oft N <l>of</l> n/-ing, <l>it</l> v-link N to-inf

value.def: A folly is a small tower or other unusual building that is built as a decoration in a large garden or park, especially in Britain in former times.
value.tran: (尤指旧时英国花园等中的)装饰性建筑
